main event: An object was observed to the west for 30-35 seconds. It appeared to be ascending and was noted to be larger than an average aircraft.
interesting points: The track was plotted to 30 mi. of the station where it faded. It was plotted to 30 miles and appeared to be picking up intermittent interference in the form of rumbling noises for the last time it appeared.
The object was described as a light, intermittently visible for periods of 10-20 seconds.
The report mentions several other UFO sightings in Ohio that were puzzling and had little scientific value.
The report discusses a case at Shaw AFB where the object approached at 250 mph but was still visible to the observers.
A previous report mentioned a 30 feet by 30 feet disc-form object that hovered about 40 feet and was observed closely.
sighted object: one object larger than an average aircraft, described as a light that was intermittently visible
